intro: Sheareria polii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has slender, branching stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its showy yellow flowers are surrounded by white ray florets, creating a daisy-like appearance. Sheareria polii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun and well-drained soil.
